title: Bunker Hill, 1956
creator_contributor_role: University of Southern California, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Cities and towns - United States
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Civil rights - United States
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/United States - Social conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Urban poor - United States
description: A study of the people who live in the downtown section of Los Angeles called Bunker Hill. Presents a typical day in their lives and the problems they must face when uprooted by the razing of the section for building offices. Uses recorded voices of the residents. Makes a plea for the preservation of Bunker Hill.
